result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason A. Stickles

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

3:47 p.m. 13CF262, 13CF292, 14CF340, 13CF365, 14CF335
Defendant Jason A Stickles in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Jason A Stickles in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
  (Request PSI report)
13CF262 to plea 
13CF292 Ct 1: to be DRI
13CF292 Ct 2: to plea 
14CF340 ct 1: to plea
14CF340 ct 2 to be dismissed
13CF365 to be DRI
14CF335 to be DRI
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CF262 counts 1 & 2: No Contest
13CF292 Count 2: No Contest
13CF340 Count 1: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

ADA Constable states requests for cash bond in 14CF340 to be amended down to $5,000 cash bond.
BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty: 
13CF262 counts 1 & 2: 
13CF292 Count 2: 
13CF340 Count 1:   Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
---
14CF340 ct 2 Dismissed
13CF365 DRI
14CF335 DRI

13CF292 Ct 1: DRI

BY THE COURT:  Court orders PSI report.
Cash bond in 14CF340 to be amended down to $5,000 cash bond. Same conditions and Add: 
  Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:   7 days per week
1/30 plea hearing - Moved Left No Address Unable to Forward
Plea hearing on January 30, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
Status conference on December 8, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Jason A. Stickles in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Jason A. Stickles in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:33 a.m. case is called.  
13CF262, 13CF365, 14CF335,  and 14CF340
This is a bond modification motion hearing.
Attorney McFarland indicates he has been attending day reporting in Waupaca County in 14CF335 & 14CF340, states his position as to the cash bond amount and requests a wage assignment.  
Court reviews the bonds in the cases.  
Attorney McFarland makes additional statement in support of his position.  
ADA Constable indicates the Day Report was allowed in Waupaca County in 13CF262 on 1-13-14.
Court reviews the bond in that file (13CF262).
State responds to the motion and objects to the modification.  Defendant has outstanding OWI cases in Waupaca County as well as these Portage County matters.  
Court states there is confusion as to where he needs to report for Day Report as well as the 3rd OWI could be 4th due to the open cases in Waupaca County.  

BTC:  
The motion to modify the bond is denied.

10:47 a.m. Court is adjourned.
Motion hearing on November 3, 2014 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Court calls case at 10:39 a.m. Defendant Jason A. Stickles in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Jason A. Stickles in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files Information cases 14CF340 and 14CF335.
Defendant received copy of information typo error on 14CF335 information and correction stated on the record.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered in both cases.

Pretrial today.
Bond Continued.

Defendant Jason A. Stickles in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Jason A. Stickles in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing on 14CF340 and 14CF335.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jason A. Stickles appeared by video. Attorney Anne Renc in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF335, 14CF340

14CF340:
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.

14CF335:
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Atty Knaapen agrees the bond in 14CF340 should cover 14CF335 as well. 
Atty Renc makes arguments regarding bond.  Asks that there be a lesser amount. 
Atty Knaapen makes arguments regarding the request.  Asks the Court to deny the request to lower the amount. 

BY THE COURT:  Request is denied.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
